title: Dispatch v1.2: Solving the Connection Friction
excerpt: Evolving the Email Assistant into Dispatch. Adding phone and social harvesting to create a true one-click connection portal.
content: A case study on how Dispatch evolved from a simple email harvester into a professional connection engine. By adding phone number and social media link harvesting (Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn), we've reduced the friction of professional outreach significantly.

title: Incident 001: Hardening the SSH Gateway
excerpt: A hands-on case study in moving beyond defaults. Challenges in repository conflicts (Kali vs Ubuntu) and port-binding nuances.
content:
In this technical deep-dive, we moved a server from the default, vulnerable state to a hardened perimeter. The Mission: Disable root login, change the default port to 2222, and limit authentication attempts.

The Challenges: We faced a 'FrankenDebian' repository conflict between Kali and Ubuntu sources on the host, which taught us the importance of environment isolation (VirtualBox). We also overcame a manual save issue in nano, confirming that in security, intent is not configuration until it is verified.

The Solution: Repository cleanup, VM isolation, and use of 'ss' radar for final port verification. The gateway is now locked.
